attributes.action: Resolve the inequity/inconsistency refunding for NHS trainees under WAT schemes
attributes.background: The WAT scheme introduced to assists NHS workers improve their knowledge on a qualifying WAT course, any payments received was to be exempt from Income tax and NI'. Virtually all staff had tax and NI deducted but reclaiming these payments for many is inequitable, inconsistent and often refused.
attributes.additional_details: The Government's refund guidelines for NHS workers quotes 'Payments made by employers to workers getting full-time instruction can be exempt from Income Tax & NI contributions if certain conditions are met' (Gov.uk).  The responses from HMRC and Trusts when trying to reclaim Tax & NI has proved to be a long laborious, inconsistent process, with lack of clarity and lack of publication of refund possibilities. Some have received Tax & NI, some only tax and others nothing whilst identical contracts.

attributes.action: After Brexit, EU dialysis provision through EHIC to remain for UK residents.
attributes.background: We urge the Minister for Health to ensure that after Brexit EU dialysis provision through the EHIC reciprocal scheme is preserved for UK residents. Otherwise people on life-saving dialysis in the UK won't be able to travel to Europe any more, unless they can afford to pay for dialysis privately.
attributes.additional_details: Fiona Loud, Policy Director at Kidney Care UK, said “We believe that every kidney patient has the right to live their life to the full and when the time comes to leave the European Union it is vital that they should still be able to travel within Europe. If there is any compromise on the EHIC system then this will effectively mean almost 30,000 people will not be able to travel for business, or take much-needed and well deserved holidays or respite breaks. This is simply not fair and cannot be allowed to happen.”

attributes.action: To condemn the repression of democracy and freedom of speech in Catalonia
attributes.background: We urge HM Government to make a clear objection to the 'de facto' suspension of Catalan institutions, the detention of democratically elected Catalan politicians & the intimidation towards Catalan media; and to pressure the Spanish Government to enter into dialogue with Catalan institutions.
attributes.additional_details: https://www.theguardian.com/world/2017/sep/20/spain-guardia-civil-raid-catalan-government-hq-referendum-row

attributes.action: Change business rates for child care providers and make them zero VAT rated.
attributes.background: Childcare has recently faced huge increases in business rates for their properties. Coupled with this, they pay VAT on purchases but are unable to reclaim this to offset against the business. Along with increased minimum wage, pensions, and 30 hours funding this is leaving them financially unstable.
attributes.additional_details:
With the onset of the Government scheme to offer 30 hours "free" childcare to parents, the minimum funding leaves the childcare provider liable to make up the shortfall. Increases in business rates & VAT charges are making this unsustainable for childcare providers. Maintained providers are already able to claim taxes paid under Section 33 of the VAT Act 1994. 
The removal of business rates & VAT rating would enable providers to continue to provide the services required without financial burden.

attributes.action: Allow Martial Arts to be on the GCSE/A Level syllabus.
attributes.background: Martial arts such as judo, taekwondo and karate have been dropped from approved activities as part of the GCSE and A Level curriculum. Martial arts promote self discipline, self confidence, respect as well as an excellent way to improve all round fitness and not to mention teaching self defence.

attributes.action: Debate in Parliament the lack of an effective policy for the treatment of M.E.
attributes.background: Myalgic Encephalomyelitis (ME) means "muscle pain plus inflammation of the brain/spinal cord", a chronic neurological illness, but "the majority of patients presenting with symptoms of ME in the UK are still referred to psychotherapists for treatment" (Dr Ian Gibson). A policy review is overdue.
attributes.additional_details:
The NHS provides psychiatric therapies for what it refers to as "CFS/ME". These therapies are often ineffective and sometimes make patients worse. They are the result of a Myalgic Encephalomyelitis policy heavily influenced by psychiatrists who are skeptical about the existence of Myalgic Encephalomyelitis. It is time for a policy re-think about the effectiveness (and cost-effectiveness) of current treatment.
See: http://www.tymestrust.org (for the effect of current policy on children with ME).

attributes.action: Adopt the EU's Anti Tax Avoidance Directive whether we leave or remain in the EU
attributes.background: To stop the UK becoming a tax haven when we leave the EU.  Where the less well off bear a greater share of the tax burden than the very rich and corporations.
attributes.additional_details: One fear is that Brexit is simply so the very rich and corporations can avoid the EU's Anti Tax Avoidance Directive.  They would be able to store their money in the UK and aggressively avoid paying tax. If the UK adopted the EU's Anti Tax Avoidance Directive it would ensure everyone paid tax fairly and give one less reason to object to Brexit

attributes.action: Proscribe Hezbollah as a terrorist organisation in its entirety in the UK
attributes.background: There is a legal loophole in the UK that allows the flag of Hezbollah, an organisation that hates the West, is anti-Semitic and perpetrates international acts of terror, to be flown in Britain because only Hezbollah’s military wing is proscribed by the Government but not its supposed political wing.
attributes.additional_details:
However, even Hezbollah’s own leadership does not differentiate between the two.  Speaking in October 2012, Hezbollah's Deputy Secretary General Naim Qassem stated: "We don't have a military wing and a political one; we don't have Hezbollah on one hand and the resistance party on the other."

This petition calls upon Home Secretary Amber Rudd to once and for all listen to Hezbollah themselves and proscribe Hezbollah as a terrorist organisation in its entirety in the UK.

attributes.action: Rule out UK government joining the US in future involvement against North Korea.
attributes.background: The British Government has refused to rule out joining its US ally in using military force against North Korea. We, the British public, must be promised that the UK will not join the US in military aggressions against N. Korea. It will cost millions of lives and leave our nation in financial ruin.
attributes.additional_details:
The British Government has refused to rule out joining its US ally in using military force against North Korea after Donald Trump threatened to totally destroy the rogue state if attacked.

http://www.msn.com/en-gb/news/uknews/joining-united-states-in-military-action-against-north-korea-a-possibility-downing-street-says/ar-AAsemmO?ocid=sf


http://www.express.co.uk/news/world/847490/china-north-korea-outrageous-missile-blast-japan-theresa-may

attributes.action: Exempt kinship care households from the 2 child restriction on child tax credit
attributes.background: There are around 200,000 children being raised by kinship carers across the UK. Kinship carers are grandparents, older siblings and other relatives and friends who step in to care for children, many of whom would otherwise be in the care system.
attributes.additional_details: 49% of kinship carers have to give up work to take on the children (Family Rights Group Survey). This often pushes the household into poverty. Some kinship carers are being hit by the new child tax credit limit. Kinship carers already raising two children can't now claim child tax credit for any baby to whom they then give birth. This penalises, for example, young women raising their teenage siblings following their parents' death, who now can't claim child tax credit for their own baby.

attributes.action: Video record all PIP, ESA and DLA medical assessments with patient consent
attributes.background: Change the law so that Personal Independence Payment (PIP), Employment Support Allowance (ESA) and Disability Living Allowance (DLA) assessments must be video recorded, if the patient consents, in order for a more accurate outcome honest outcome.
attributes.additional_details: Many people are being refused what they are quite rightly entitled to because many assessments aren't accurate and don't show the needs of each disabled individual, being they are wheelchair bound or mentally ill. Let's change the law in order to get a fair decision. Putting people in physical pain through more pain and the mentally ill questioning why people think they are fine when they are clearly not! Let's help make a difference. Let us the people who live with these illnesses have a voice!

attributes.action: Stop killing badgers
attributes.background: Bovine TB is spread in other ways, not just by badgers. Science does not support the continued killing of badgers. This cull is unfounded and must stop. Why should cows be more important than badgers anyway? Protecting businesses before wildlife.

attributes.action: All halal and kosher meat to be labelled with method of production and slaughter
attributes.background: The UK invoked the religious exemption from the EU's slaughter directive 2009. More halal slaughter is carried out in the UK than in the rest of Europe. We eat halal meat unwittingly in schools, planes, hospitals and buy it from outlets and supermarkets as it is sold without being labelled as such.
attributes.additional_details: Compulsory labelling would allow informed consumer choice and reduce conflict with other religious groups' preferences. Labelling must apply to 100% of the product and by-product of any ritually slaughtered animal or bird. The hindquarters of an animal are regarded as non-Halal even if the Halal method of slaughter was used so labelling must be precise. All imported meats and by-products should also be clearly labelled to show country of origin, method of production and transport, and slaughter.

attributes.action: Abolish the 0.7% GDP target for Foreign Aid
attributes.background: The Government currently spends 0.7% GDP on Foreign Aid. This means it will spend over £13bn of tax payers money on projects which could be better spent at home. By 2020 this figure will have risen to almost £16bn. We believe the Government should abolish the 0.7% GDP target for Foreign Aid.
attributes.additional_details: The Government should abolish the 0.7% GDP target for Foreign Aid and spend the money on increasing our Defence and Armed Forces.

attributes.action: Ban attendance awards in schools
attributes.background:
BAN ATTENDANCE AWARDS
Those are:
-       Highly discriminatory
-       Promote inequality
-       Highly unfair
-       Encourage bullying
-       Force parents to send poorly children to school which puts at risk
children with weaker immune system
attributes.additional_details:
Attendance awards are the proof that DfE has no regard to section 149 Equality Act 2010. Attendance schemes promote inequality, children with disabilities do not have as high chances to receive the school award as children with good health. 
Those are:
-       Highly discriminatory
-       Promote inequality
-       Highly unfair
-       Encourage bullying
-       Force parents to send poorly children to school which puts at risk children with weaker immune system

attributes.action: Stop oversized and hazardous goods vehicles using the Dartford Tunnel
attributes.background: We’re a logistics business headquartered in Dartford and we’ve officially had enough of the Dartford traffic jam. Our simple solution: Stop oversized & hazardous goods vehicles using the Dartford Tunnel.
attributes.additional_details:
We propose a simple solution: Stop the Convoys and get Dartford moving. Traffic at the Dartford Tunnel is brought to a standstill on average 100 times a day by a small number of oversized & hazardous goods vehicles which need to be escorted through the tunnel, in a convoy. 
Each convoy can take up to 2.5 mins to travel through the tunnel, and a tunnel is closed around every 15 mins. 
Why should 99% of drivers suffer due to less than 1% of vehicles? 
Our suggestion is simple: Stop these oversized/hazardous vehicles using the tunnel & send them the other way around the M25.

attributes.action: To allow Christopher Maurice Brown (singer) to be allowed into the UK
attributes.background: Since the incident in 2009 when Chris Brown wrongfully abused his ex girlfriend Rihanna, he was no longer allowed to enter the UK, almost 10 years later he still isn't able to visit our country. He has paid his debt to society and publicly apologised. He has suffered enough. Bring BROWN BACK!
attributes.additional_details:
This happened near enough 10 years ago! 
We need his talent to be aloud back in the UK! To be allowed to perform.

attributes.action: Review the share of Government money spent on Northamptonshire services
attributes.background:
Several ​le​ss-deprived counties ​get much more spent on them per head than​ Northamptonshire​, mainly due to an out-of-date funding model​.

We need a fairer allocation scheme to better reflect today’s population growth and levels of deprivation in Northamptonshire.
attributes.additional_details:
We need to properly fund our roads, child social care, police, NHS and fire service and look after our elderly people. All of these are falling further behind other counties every year.

Surrey gets £134 more per person​ this year despite being considerably ​less needy, according to Government statistics.

The Local Government Association says Northamptonshire is the county least able to fund itself in the future.

attributes.action: School staff are worth 5%, children deserve properly funded schools
attributes.background: We think that after years of below inflation pay awards which have cut their living standards, staff in all our schools deserve a 5 percent pay rise.
attributes.additional_details:
With inflation, including housing, running at 3.9 percent this would in reality be a modest 1.1 percent rise in real terms and so a small step towards undoing the much greater cuts school staff have suffered in the last few years.

We also want the government to change its funding plans which at present will mean almost 9 in 10 schools seeing significant cuts which will damage education. Schools should be properly funded, including the cost of a modest rise in school staff pay, so that our children get the education they deserve.

We call on the government to address the linked issues of school funding and school staff pay in its budget plans this autumn.

#Worth5percent

attributes.action: Put General Practitioners on the Home Office's 'Shortage Occupation List'
attributes.background: GP Practices in rural areas struggle to recruit doctors, forcing many surgeries to close. There are many GPs from outside the EU who would like to work in the UK. However, Practices can't offer them a job without going though the visa bureaucracy, and the NHS is losing many good doctors as a result.
attributes.additional_details:
Lincolnshire patients are suffering due to the lack of GPs [1]. In Lincoln, surgeries are closing as a result [2]. The Home Office have been asked to put GPs on the 'shortage occupation' list, but have refused to do this. This is unacceptable.   
[1] http://lincolnshirereporter.co.uk/2017/09/i-dont-bother-trying-anymore-man-with-heart-disease-says-queues-outside-gp-are-now-a-joke/
[2] http://thelincolnite.co.uk/2017/09/lincoln-gp-surgery-close-merge-new-plans/

attributes.action: Give the blood bike community section 19 exemptions for blue light runs
attributes.background:
There are 27 blood bike groups up and down the UK that respond to a call for help every night from their local NHS.
They willingly transport urgent medical supplies from hospital or hospital overnight free and voluntarily.
Help us get the emergency delivery to its destination sooner with S19
attributes.additional_details:
At present if the selected rider/driver receives a Blue Light call they can not:
• exceed the speed limit
• treat a red light as a give way
• go to the right of a keep left barrier
• Use audible warning equipment

E.G.
it's 2am, nothing on the road, they still have to:
• travel along EVERY road at the speed limit
• stand at a red light with nothing using the green light.

If we are granted section 19's that few minutes could be the difference in saving a life someday

attributes.action: Improve Availability of NHS Services for FND Sufferers
attributes.background: Functional Neurological Disorder sufferers are often left with limited & insufficient treatment options. Treatment requires a team of neurologists, physiotherapists etc. which must be integrated to create an effective plan. Currently, services are not equipped for this kind of specialist care.
attributes.additional_details: Up to 1/3 of all neurological referrals are diagnosed with FND. Sufferers end up relinquishing their independence & become reliant on a carer.  They are left unable to function & it’s vital we improve prospects. Medically Unexplained Symptoms (including FND) directly cost the NHS approximately £3.1 billion, with an additional £18 billion in indirect costs. With an NHS already under pressure, improving services and treatment for those with FND would greatly lift this burden.

attributes.action: Stop plans to exempt vehicles more than 40 years old from roadworthiness tests
attributes.background:
The Department for Transport has announced that it intends to exempt most vehicles that are more than 40 years old from annual roadworthiness tests (MoT) from May 2018.

The Government should reconsider this and aim for all vehicles to be given independent annual inspections for safety reasons.
attributes.additional_details: When respondents to the Government’s consultation were asked whether these vehicles – including many classic cars  and motorcycles – should be exempted from MoT tests, more than half were opposed. The DfT's own figures indicate that only 6% of pre-1960 vehicles, already exempt, are voluntarily tested. If this is also the case for vehicles over 40 years old when the exemption is introduced then there is a risk that safety-critical faults on more than 293,000 vehicles will not be detected.

attributes.action: Require HMRC to separate out the cost of Brexit on personal tax statements.
attributes.background: The UK Government is taking us out of the EU whatever the cost. During the referendum campaign, much was made of the cost of membership of the EU. There will be costs to leave the EU - public sector time, research and consultancy fees, legal costs, repayments, and so on. These should be identified.
attributes.additional_details: The 'Vote Leave' campaign advertised a fee of £350m per week going to the EU (£18.2bn per year), while the ONS calculates the true value to be £9.9bn per year (http://visual.ons.gov.uk/uk-perspectives-2016-the-uk-contribution-to-the-eu-budget/). Brexit is predicted to cost an additional £60bn (https://www.ft.com/content/51a19263-9788-37b9-a9fa-8cd307265edf). This will have consequences for government spending and tax rates - taxpayers must be able to understand where their money is being used.

attributes.action: Introduce the British Empire as a mandatory part of the Key Stage 3 curriculum
attributes.background: Currently the British Empire is an optional and small footnote on the History syllabus. A thorough and balanced mandatory module should be introduced to proportionally reflect the impact the Empire has had on our diverse UK population, and its impact on public attitudes towards immigration and race.

attributes.action: The undersigned demand the following terms are included in any UK Brexit deal.
attributes.background: To include a deduction for the value of the UK’s share of funds held by the European Investment bank, EU loans, EU properties, cash and any other EU investments and assets, the total of which will offset any financial payment(s) made to the EU in whatever form as part of our final Brexit agreement.

attributes.action: Recognise nonbinary people in law
attributes.background: We call on the government to recognise nonbinary people in law as distinct from men and women, in the form of a third gender option on passports and birth certificates, the ability to change one's gender legally to a third option with a gender recognition certificate as trans men and women can, etc.
attributes.additional_details: The best estimate we have is that around 0.4% of people are nonbinary (EHRC), over 250,000 people in the UK, comparable to the number of Buddhists in the UK - yet we are not counted in the UK census. We are not protected by the Equality Act unless someone thinks we're trans, we are required to pretend to be men or women when getting married, companies are not required to provide toilets or changing rooms for us, when we're in prison we share it with people whose genders differ from our own.

attributes.action: Return Scottish devolved powers to UK Government and Parliament
attributes.background: Devolved Powers have not delivered real benefit to the people of Scotland and Many people are disillusioned by the Government and constant demands for Independence Referendums.

attributes.action: Stop The Genocide In Myanmar - UK Government Please Help!
attributes.background: Hundreds have been forced to flee their villages as the emergency situation in Myanmar has worsened. Urgent needs of displaced people include water, hygiene facilities, food & shelter.
attributes.additional_details: The Burmese government, along with radical Burmese Buddhists, are attempting to exterminate the Rohingya people through direct violence and denial of rights. the Rohingya people have been denied basic human rights both inside their native Burma and have been subjected to routine forced labour, and have been resettled on unfarmable land while their previous lands have been confiscated and given to Buddhist settlers from elsewhere Violence and oppression in Burma have forced many Rohingya to flee.

attributes.action: Mandate that patients are told if their NHS referral is to a private provider.
attributes.background: NHS patients are often not informed when their referral is to a private and not an NHS provider. They are entitled to choose who provides their care and should not be referred to the private sector by default. Patients have a choice under the NHS Constitution and they should be informed of this.
attributes.additional_details: A relative needed an Opthalmology opinion and so was referred. The referral choices were to one private company with a choice of five venues. An NHS option was not given despite being available locally. This was because a block of care had been purchased from this private company in advance. A referral to the NHS would have meant a second payment for this care. Challenge by the relative resulted in an NHS appointment. This practice is unfair to both patient and the NHS and should stop.

attributes.action: Make desecration of war memorials and symbols of remembrance a criminal offence.
attributes.background:
War memorials were constructed at the center of towns and villages so that people could be reminded of the sacrifices made by brave men and women who died to preserve our freedom.
Poppies and other items are placed at these memorials to ensure we do not forget those sacrifices.
attributes.additional_details:
There are now too many instances of people that think it is in order to desecrate these memorials, poppies and other items which are there to remind us of a debt owed to the many that gave their lives so that we could be free.
Desecrating of war memorials, items purchased and placed on these memorials are to be respected.
Whatever political, religious or ethnic issues people may have, their argument cannot be with the fallen heroes of another generation.

attributes.action: Make it mandatory all processed meat products carry a Government health warning
attributes.background:
In 2015 the World Health Organisation classified all processed meat products as group 1 carcinogens after extensive studies proved them to be a known cause of colorectal cancer
To date the Government has not acted responsibly and  failed to make this information widely known to the general public.
attributes.additional_details:
We would like to see a proper campaign to enlighten the public of the health risks if they are consuming these products, starting with making it mandatory to include a Government health warning on the packing of all processed meat products and removing all processed meat products  from schools. 

Link to the World Health Organisation information regarding processed meat:
http://www.who.int/features/qa/cancer-red-meat/en/

attributes.action: Stop the proposed Warrington Western Link
attributes.background:
We, the undersigned, call upon HM Government and Dept of transport NOT to fund the Warrington Western Link route. The negative impacts to the people of Warrington are too severe to warrant the;
- cost
- disruption
- increase in traffic
- destruction of greenbelt land
- increased air pollution

attributes.action: Reduce student loan interest to an affordable 1% over base rate.
attributes.background: With the current punitive and profiteering rate of RPI + 3% typical loans of £50k require a salary of £55k pa just to pay the £3,000 interest. The rate charged is excessive and leaves a lifetime millstone for most graduate leavers. Give the majority an attainable goal and a sense of hope!

attributes.action: Stop The Closure Of Darlington A&E
attributes.background: We can’t let Darlington A&E close down. It will cause people to travel excessive distances and if they don't have a car this may not be possible. It will also put strain on the out of town hospitals and will endanger lives that are emergencies.
attributes.additional_details: The Last petition closed early because of a General Election with 7,313 signatures

attributes.action: UK Government to pass a law requiring Vets to scan all newly registered animals.
attributes.background:
In March this year my British Shorthair Tabby disappeared.  Extensive searches were made contacting all organisations. On targetting Veterinary Surgeries not all were routinely scanning newly registered cats and dogs which was concerning.
I want any suspected thefts to be reported to the Police.
attributes.additional_details: Subsequently another two similar profile cats have disappeared within 0.5miles of my rural community. While these incidents have been reported to local Police their hands are tied and limited with what they can actually do. This loophole allows unscrupulous thieves to identify themselves as the owners thus depriving the true owners of their treasured pets. Kennel Club figures for 2014 show 70,000 animals missing/stolen and Direct Line figures for 2015/16 show cat theft up by 40% and the true numbers of thefts nearer 360,000. Only 10% of cats were retrieved by microchip which in large part is due to the inconsistency of scanning newly registered animals.

attributes.action: Introduce a 5p charge on single-use plastic straws.
attributes.background: Over 550 million plastic straws are used every day in the US & UK. Most plastic straws are not recycled. Plastic waste poses an enormous threat to wildlife, is a danger to human health and costs millions to the UK economy. A 5p charge on single-use plastic straws will reduce our plastic waste.
attributes.additional_details:
Almost every piece of plastic ever produced still exists today. Most single-use plastic straws are discarded, often winding up in landfill, or contributing to the 8 million tons of plastic entering the sea every year.
Following the introduction of the 5p charge on plastic carrier bags in England, usage fell by 85% in just 6 months. We can achieve the same with plastic straws. 
#FinalStraw are campaigning to reduce single-use plastics in the UK. More info: http://bit.ly/2y73U3N

attributes.action: End the Help to Buy scheme and instead direct this funding into social housing
attributes.background: The UK government's funding of the Help to Buy scheme constitutes a fundamental misuse of public funds and fails to deliver the much needed affordable housing for the people of the UK. Property developers are profiteering at the nation's expense whilst failing to provide homes we so desperately need

attributes.action: Make Bullying a Criminal Offence
attributes.background: Bullying ruins the life of victims. Sadly, it is a daily occurrence for some schoolchildren and is sometimes so severe that victims self-harm, lose out on schooling, or even like my son Brandon take their own life.
attributes.additional_details: The police in my son's case refused to investigate as my son was not attending school. This cannot be right. I call upon the Government to urgently produce guidelines for the investigation of and prosecution of offences which arise out of bullying and to plug the gaps in the law where the victim has been harmed due to bullying, which is not recognised as an offence. Without penalties being imposed there is no guarantee that others won't be hurt.'

attributes.action: Change law and tax rules to ensure equal pay for equal work for agency workers
attributes.background: Many workers work through agencies using umbrella companies to handle pay. This is used to pay workers less by avoiding Employers NI. ENI is deducted from workers’ wages. This petition seeks a law to prevent workers getting less take-home pay than directly employed people doing work of equal value.
attributes.additional_details: There must be equal take-home pay for equal work for agency workers. Umbrella companies say that workers agree to work like this, but we know in the industry that this is not so and that workers are not given a choice and must go umbrella if they want to get employment. This is a widespread practice that is  hurting the pockets of vulnerable workers.

attributes.action: End the United Kingdom's trading of weapons to Saudi Arabia
attributes.background: Thousands of innocent Yemenese women and children are being slaughtered by our weapons in which we sell to Saudi Arabia; this selfish means of trading needs to be abruptly halted before thousands more innocent civilians die as a consequence.

attributes.action: Change CICA policy that states children age 12+ can “consent in fact” to sex
attributes.background:
Children from age 12y could be refused compensation for sexual abuse on grounds they consented under revised rules.
The Criminal Injuries Compensation Authority (CICA) review of its guidelines revealed that almost 700 child victims were denied payments, even where the attacker was jailed.
attributes.additional_details:
The age of consent is 16 for good reason. It reflects the cognitive, emotional and social development required as an absolute minimum to consent to sex. The current CICA guidelines flies in face of this, notwithstanding ignoring the context in which "consent" occurs. Coercion, fear and manipulation are part of these offences and as such "consent in fact" is null and void. 
Such victim blaming is wrong, unhelpful and psychologically damaging. As such, this should be fully debated in Parliament.

attributes.action: The MCA must send launch request to RNLI when fishing boats are reported overdue
attributes.background:
Fishing is the UK's most dangerous peacetime occupation. The Marine & Coastguard Agency must immediately task RNLI lifeboats when 
1) A fishing vessel is reported overdue by a harbour or family member. 2) A distress signal is received.
attributes.additional_details: Any delay in the MCA tasking the RNLI can mean the difference of life and death for a fisherman. There is not an RNLI crew in the country that would mind being called to station to launch, only later to be stood down because all is well with a vessel. A change of protocol to require the MCA to immediately task the local RNLI crews is needed urgently. Worse things happen at sea and even short delays can mean the difference between the rescue of a survivor, or the recovery of a body.

attributes.action: Amend PIP rules so that mentally disabled adults can get a Blue Parking Badge.
attributes.background: Currently rules on Personal Independence Payments mean that mobility points, which allow people to access a Blue Badge for disability parking, are allocated on physical capacity to walk, only, not a mental impairment. This is demonstrably unrealistic and impacts people with disabilities and carers
attributes.additional_details: My learning disabled daughter Emily can physically walk but this doesn't mean she can always do so safely. My mum had dementia, she was able to walk but unable to appreciate the dangers around her. A Blue Badge is a passport to understanding and to life. To refuse to allocate a blue badge, unless a person's ability to walk is affected, is morally and factually wrong.This needs to be addressed and urgently amended, so that all disabled people are treated equally by the authorities and by society.

attributes.action: Lift the ban on hand guns and allow everyone to own any firearm.
attributes.background: It's about time the ban on handguns and civilians owning them was lifted. The only people affected by the ban are law abiding citizens that lost their right to own firearms. The ban hasn't stopped criminals from buying or using firearms at all.

attributes.action: To have a second referendum on Brexit once a final agreement with the EU agreed.
attributes.background: Whether we stay or go, I believe that final decision should only be based on clear and understandable information. It is clear that our and EU politicians are more interested in their own politicking rather than ensuring a stable and highly productive Country/Countries.
attributes.additional_details: Inner city Manchester Born and Bred. Degree in Economics. Lived in Moss Side/Whalley Range, Weybridge, Warsaw, Geneva and now back in Weybridge. Have two exceptional daughters for whom I have the only desire to leave a better world for them and future generations. Incredible friends around the world. Together we are something, alone we are nothing. Let's make sure any decision we reach is based on fact not fiction.

attributes.action: Introduce an unconditional, Universal Basic Income
attributes.background:
With ever more jobs becoming automatable, risking vast unemployment, a regular unconditional dividend should be paid to every citizen to provide a decent standard of living and stimulate the economy from the bottom up.

This will also reduce crime, healthcare costs and improve education outcomes.
attributes.additional_details:
Here is a further list of reasons to pay a basic income: http://www.basicincome.org.uk/reasons-support-basic-income

And some preliminary results from a trial in Finland: https://www.weforum.org/agenda/2017/05/finlands-basic-income-experiment-is-already-making-people-feel-better-after-just-4-months

And a study into the likely impact of automation on future employment:
http://www.oxfordmartin.ox.ac.uk/downloads/academic/The_Future_of_Employment.pdf

attributes.action: Having knocked over a cat, the driver must legally stop to help/trace the owner
attributes.background: We have lost two cats to road traffic accidents. On both occasions the drivers did not stop to check if the cat could be saved. It is a criminal offence not to stop and report an accident involving a dog. Whilst cats are more independent they are still a beloved pet and should be respected equally.

attributes.action: Stop electoral fraud by creating a national database of voters
attributes.background: There is insufficient rigour applied to the voting process and it is open to error and fraud because it is not national, has insufficient identity checks on an individual, and does not include an individual’s voting rights. A national database and appropriate identity checks would resolve this.
attributes.additional_details:
An individual, e.g. student or home-owner, may have two places of residence, in different local authorities. They are entitled to vote in both local authority elections but by law they are only allowed to vote once in a national election.
The individual does not have to specify at which residence they would like to cast their national vote, so they receive two polling cards and whilst it is illegal to vote twice there is no validation carried out to stop this.

attributes.action: Continue to recognise and allow the Inbound European Au Pair program post Brexit
attributes.background: We, the undersigned and BAPAA, are greatly concerned that the UK government has not prioritised the importance of Au Pairs to the British economy during the Brexit negotiations.  Our formal representations to government ministers have been ignored and yet Au Pairs are vital to the British economy.
attributes.additional_details: Thousands of hard-working parents rely on European Au pairs to enable them to juggle their work life balance.  Au Pairs receive pocket money and live as part of a family to experience British culture and family life and to learn English. This affordable program provides UK families with flexible childcare and enables young Europeans to study English and be introduced to British values at no cost to our government.  Brexit must ensure the continuation of this valuable cultural exchange programme.
